pull.title: -bip148 option
pull.body: This is based on luke-jr's "non-dos(100)" version of the code, it is mutually exclusive with  #10442.   More discussion is in  #10428.

events.body: For reference, just the DoS rework/fixes are in #10512

Travis failure is due to
```
WARNING! The following scripts are not being run: ['bip148-segwit-uasf.py']. Check the test lists in test_runner.py.
```
I think....

> Travis failure is due to *WARNING! The following scripts are not being run: ['bip148-segwit-uasf.py']. Check the test lists in test_runner.py.* I think....

Correct - on Travis it's a failure condition to have a functional test that isn't included in either `BASE_SCRIPTS` or `EXTENDED_SCRIPTS` in test_runner.py

events.message: Bugfix: Don't ban peers just because they have header chains we consider invalid
Instead of DoS banning for invalid blocks, merely disconnect nodes if we're relying on them as a primary node

events.body: Rebased on top of #10593 and #10594, and fixed test issues.

events.message: Bugfix: net: Apply whitelisting criteria to outgoing connections
Define a service bit for BIP148
Add BIP148 indicator to user agent comments

bip148: functional test

Basic functional test for behaviour with -bip148 flag.
bip148: ensure nodes are synced prior to bip148 date
Move BIP148 logic into dedicated CheckBIP148 function
Check BIP148 on historical blocks and rewind if necessary
Preferentially peer with nodes enforcing BIP148 to avoid partitioning risk
When we find an invalid block violating BIP148 that has already been pruned, error immediately, rather than silently fail to rewind

events.body: Concurrence on something that would allow user to opt-in would be grand.  Cheers

Is this branch actively maintained / usable / recommended?

Is there a reason why it's not in the upstream? (I don't follow bitcoin-dev mailing list)
@runn1ng For now, I would recommend users upgrade to https://github.com/UASF/bitcoin/
Yes, the UASF branch is there, this one doesn't seem to be maintained actively (not even the travis issue has been fixed).
@luke-jr Thanks! Would you recommend to use `0.14-BIP148` branch directly, or the `v0.14.2-uasfsegwit0.3` tag (which is a little behind, but is the last "release")?
